intro: Polygala nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stem milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in spikelike clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. The species is adapted to dry environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
